III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on
1

duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth O and Youth A are TCWs and unrelated residents at Vista
Maria Child Caring Institution. A few weeks ago, inappropriate
touching occurred between Youth O and Youth A.
Investigation I interviewed Staff 1/complainant via telephone on 01/09/2023 and
confirmed the information in the allegations. Staff 1 is a team
leader and has been working at the facility for 6 years. Staff 1
reported that on 01/07/2023 Youth O and Youth A got into a
physical altercation, after they were separated Youth O alleged
that she and Youth A engaged in inappropriate touching a few
weeks prior, while standing in the medication dispensing line and
in the living area. Youth O did not provide a date or time when this
occurred. She said an incident report was written and staff were
informed of the incident.
I met with Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on 01/10/2023.
Rights Officer reported on 01/07/2023 around 8 pm Youth O and
Youth A were involved in a physical altercation and after the
altercation Youth O told staff that a few weeks ago she and Youth
A engaged in inappropriate touching. He said there are no
previous reports of this happening and Youth O did not provide
date, time, or any other information. He said staff were notified
and Youth O was moved to another unit. Rights Officer said this
was the second time that Youth O had to be moved to a different
unit. The first time was due to conflict with another resident.
I Interviewed Youth O at the facility on 01/10/2023. Youth O
reported she has been at the facility for four months and is
currently on B-wing. She was moved from C-wing to B-wing two
days ago. When asked about the allegations, Youth O refused to
answer any questions. Several attempts were made to gather
information, but Youth O was adamant about not wanting to talk
about the allegations or continue with the interview. Youth O did
report that there is always a staff member supervising the
residents on the wing.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 01/10/2023. Youth A has
been at the facility for one month and is placed on C-wing. Youth
A admitted to getting into a physical altercation with Youth O on
2

01/07/2023. Youth A said Youth O made up false allegations
about her. Youth A denied touching or doing anything in
appropriate with Youth O. Youth A said there were two incidents a
couple weeks ago involving Youth O. The first incident she and
Youth O were sitting at the table on the wing and Youth O placed
her hand on Youth A’s knee. Youth A said she immediately
removed Youth O’s hand and told Youth O to not do that. There
was another incident while they were standing in line and Youth O
grabbed Youth A’s “butt”. Youth A said she addressed the incident
with Youth O, and again told Youth O not to touch her like that.
Youth A said staff members were in the room, but they did not see
Youth O when she grabbed her “butt”. Youth A denied telling staff
about the two incidents involving Youth O. Youth A said she and
Youth O got into a physical altercation, because Youth O made up
lies and was calling her names. Youth A expressed no concerns
regarding staff supervision or the facility. Youth A said Youth O
has been moved to another wing and she has not had any contact
with Youth O since they got into a physical altercation.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 01/10/2023. Youth B has
been at the facility for one month and placed on C-Wing. She
expressed no concerns regarding supervision, or any of the
youths on the wing.
I interviewed Therapist at the facility on 01/10/2023. She reported
Youth O does struggle with being honest and has trust issues.
She does have a history of taking inappropriate pictures and
sending to boys, being promiscuous, and struggles with social
boundaries. Youth O has not reported or expressed any concerns
regarding inappropriate touching with other girls. She said
because of what was alleged a safety plan will be developed and
Youth O has been moved to different wing.
I interviewed Youth O’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on
01/13/2023. She said there are no prior sexual behavior
complaints. Youth O has a history making up allegations regarding
relatives, but no complaints regarding other youths. She has tried
to talk to Youth O about the allegations, but Youth O refused to
talk to her. Foster Care Specialist expressed no concerns
regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on
01/27/2023. Foster Care Specialist spoke with Youth A after the
complaint was received and Youth A reported that Youth O was
flirting and did touch her inappropriately, but she didn’t report it to
staff. Foster Care Specialist said Youth O was moved to a
3

different wing and so Youth A did not have any other issues or
concerns.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 01/27/2023. Staff 2 is a
Youth Coach and has been working at the facility for one year.
She reported on 01/07/2023 Youth A and Youth O exchanged
words while in the cafeteria and that’s when Youth A pulled Youth
O’s hair and pushed Youth O. She and Staff 3 immediately
intervened by separating the two youths. She said there were no
reported injuries. She spoke with Youth A and Staff 1 spoke with
Youth O. Youth A told her that Youth O was “running her mouth”
and lying about her. Staff 2 denied witnessing or hearing about the
inappropriate touching prior to the incident on 01/07/2023. Staff 2
said Youth O was moved to a different wing after Youth O
reported inappropriate touching.
I interviewed Staff 3 via telephone on 01/27/2023. Staff 3 is a
Youth Coach and has been working at the facility for 5 years. Staff
3 reported on 01/07/2023 she witnessed Youth A run up to Youth
O, pulled her hair and push her. She and Staff 2 immediately
separated the two youths. She denied witnessing or hearing about
any inappropriate touching prior to this incident.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 01/07/2023, written by Staff 2. Youth A
went up to Youth O pulled her hair and pushed her to the ground.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 intervened and separated the two youths.
• Incident report dated 01/07/2023, written by Staff 1, Youth O
reported to Staff 1 that she and Youth A engaged in inappropriate
touching a few weeks ago, while standing in line and in the living
area of the wing.
• Safety Plan for Youth O dated 01/10/2023 was put in place to
assist with promoting safe boundaries/interactions with her peers.
Interventions/support from staff and therapist with using
appropriate decision-making skills and coping skills will be
implemented. Youth O is to remain on Behavior Monitoring
Observations, is to remain within 6 feet of staff, will need to buddy
with staff during transports, must utilize the bathroom and laundry
room without other peers; if Youth O enters either room with
another peer, staff must be present. Youth O is to be first in the
medication line, or medications can be administered to her on the
wing. This plan will be monitored weekly at clinical or team
meetings. If there are concerns or feedback for this plan, staff can
directly contact therapist.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff were not supervising or were aware of Youth O
4

and Youth A inappropriately touching. Youth O refused to answer
questions related to the allegations. Youth A reported there were
two incidents; one where Youth O put her hand on her knee while
sitting at the table and another time Youth O grabbed her “butt”
while standing in line. Youth A reported staff were present but did
not see the incidents. The facility immediately moved Youth O to
different wing and developed a safety plan to address Youth O’s
behavior.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
